document.masterDocTitle: Variable Selection and Inference for Multi-period Forecasting Problems

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Variable Selection and Inference for Multi-period Forecasting Problems

subSubSection.paragraph:
Diagnosis. The male is unknown. The female is similar to those of
P. pondoensis
and
P. disposita
.
P. pastinella
differs from
P. pondoensis
in the larger body length and from
P. disposita
in the lack of an oily bluish shine on the scutum.
P. pearstonensis
,
P. chubbi
and
P. cinctifera
differ from
P. pastinella
in having reddish metasomal terga.

caption.paragraph:
FIGURE 75.
Patellapis
( Ch .) pastinella
, female: a. Head (scale=0,5mm); b. Scutum (scale=0,5mm); c. Scutellum and propodeum (scale=0,5mm); d. Metasomal terga (scale=1mm); e. Body (scale=1mm); f. Inner hind tibial spur (scale=100µm); g. Basitibial plate (scale=100µm).

subSubSection.paragraph:

Distribution ( Fig. 76 ). Records exist only from the east and north-east of South Africa ( Eastern Cape , KwaZulu–Natal, North West , Gauteng , Limpopo and Free State ).
